page.title: 05Farms 1
page.content:
KIRKLAND HOW FARM: This farm is 485 years old and has always been in use as a farm. It has 93 acres and is mainly grazing for the livestock. When the animals are ready for market they are taken to market to either Carlisle or nearby Cockermouth.
BROWNRIGG FARM: This farm was built in 1694 and like others in the area it has a private water supply. It is built of sandstone which is available not too far away. The farm has different types of sheep and cattle and the usual kinds of machinery to be found on small farms such as milking machine, tractors and muck-spreader.
